gov.nasa.arc.mct.components
Interface TimeConversion

public interface TimeConversion

A TimeConversion is a capability components may support, where incoming data may be converted from its native format to MCT's internal time.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String convertFromUNIXTime(long localTimeMillis)
          Convert the supplied UNIX epoch time to whatever time representation this conversion generally supports.
 long convertToUNIXTime(java.lang.String encodedTime)
          Convert this object to the UNIX epoch.
 boolean isTimer()
          Should this be interpreted as a timer?
 

Method Detail

convertToUNIXTime

long convertToUNIXTime(java.lang.String encodedTime)
Convert this object to the UNIX epoch.

Parameters:
encodedTime - some encoded representation of a time
Returns:
milliseconds elapsed since start of UNIX epoch

convertFromUNIXTime

java.lang.String convertFromUNIXTime(long localTimeMillis)
Convert the supplied UNIX epoch time to whatever time representation this conversion generally supports.

Parameters:
localTimeMillis - milliseconds elapsed wince start of UNIX epoch
Returns:
an encoded representation of the time

isTimer

boolean isTimer()
Should this be interpreted as a timer? (otherwise, it will be interpreted as a clock - for instance, negative numbers will be rendered as before the epoch, instead of as negative times.)

Returns:
true if a timer, false if a clock
